result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Robert Orr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Restitution in the amount of $7,500 to Roland Machinery (joint and several).  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all other costs, assessments and surcharges due to the amount of restitution owed.
Failure to pay any restitution or DNA surcharge owed will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with the co-actors and the area of South 5th Avenue in the City of Oak Creek, Milwaukee County where the crime was committed.
Cooperate with any programs or treatment recommended by the agent.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment.Absolute Sobriety. Random screens.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Judge Cimpl on 12/12/2016, the court indicated that it will not be amending the JOC to add a surcharge to count three.  Informed Jade Alegre at DOC of the same.  No further action necessary.
Letter from DOC requesting clarification of DNA surcharges.

Clarification of Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction dated 2/19/2016:  At the plea hearing on 9/14/2015 pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Worksheet

Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  3 and 1/2  years with  213 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 years;  CONCURRENT to any sentence now being served
- Court orders DNA sample and pay the surcharge - as to Count 2 only

As to Count 3:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  3 and 1/2 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1 and 1/2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 years; CONSECUTIVE to the sentence imposed as to Count 2.  COURT STAYS the sentence (as to Count 3) and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3  years.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance abuse Program.

- Court sets Restitution in the amount of $7,500 - joint and several

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION and EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
-  no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause
-  cooperate with any programs or treatment recommended by the agent
-  AODA assessment and comply with any treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  No Contact Order with the co-actors and the area of South 5th Avenue in the City of Oak Creek, Milwaukee County where the crime was committed.
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $7,500 to Roland Machinery (joint and several).  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Court waives all other costs, assessments and surcharges due to the amount of restitution owed.
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment 
-  Failure to pay any restitution or DNA surcharge owed will result in a civil judgment

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing Hearing on Wednesday, October 28, 2015 at 1:30 PM in BR 19, SB Rm 313 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 2 & 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court orders the defendant to provide a DNA sample.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19 on 10/28/15 at 8:30 am.
Restitution worksheet, received and filed

Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests  plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Steve Sargent for Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Kyle Robert Orr not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Kyle Robert Orr not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Parties request more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in custody.  Christopher Liegel for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the address of 9006 S 5th Ave., Oak Creek or Co-Defendants Kerek Stys and Brian Nelson

Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Kyle Robert Orr in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle Robert Orr
Current: 9131 S 5th Ave, #1, Oak Creek, WI 53154 United States  (Effective: 03-31-2015)
Prior: 2609 5th Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Kyle Robert Orr not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/19/15 @ 1:30pm
